intro: Rhodiola rosea subsp. tachiroei, commonly known as the Japanese rhodiola, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It is known for its adaptogenic properties and is used in traditional medicine for its stress-relieving effects. Its botanical features make it well-suited to harsh alpine environments.
